original: Majjhima Nikāya 35
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Cūḷasaccakasutta
analyzed: cūḷa saccaka sutta
translated: With Saccaka the Disagreeable

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā vesāliyam viharati mahā vane kūṭāgāra sālāya
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Vesālī in the Great Wood in the hall with the peaked roof.

original: Tena kho pana samayena saccako nigaṇṭhaputto vesāliyaṁ paṭivasati bhassappavādako paṇḍitavādo sādhusammato bahujanassa.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ vesāliyam paṭivasati bhassa ppavādakaḥ paṇḍita vādaḥ sādhu sammataḥ bahu janassa
translated: Now on that occasion Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha was living at Vesālī. He was a debater and a teacher with his own doctrine, well-known and famous, regarded as a holy scholar, teacher, and brahman. He had many followers and was the head of an order and a school. He was a seeker after the supreme state of sublime peace.

original: So vesāliyaṁ parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati:
analyzed: saḥ vesāliyam parisati evam vācam bhāsati
translated: He spoke thus to the assembly at Vesālī:

original: “nāhaṁ taṁ passāmi samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā, saṅghiṁ gaṇiṁ gaṇācariyaṁ, api arahantaṁ
analyzed: na aham tam passāmi samaṇam vā brāhmaṇam vā saṅghim gaṇim gaṇa ācariya api arahanta
translated: “I do not see that bhikkhu, whether recluse or brahmin,

original: sammāsambuddhaṁ paṭijānamānaṁ, yo mayā vādena vādaṁ samāraddho na saṅkampeyya na🔽sampakampeyya na sampavedheyya, yassa na kacchehi sedā mucceyyuṁ.
analyzed: sammāsambuddham paṭijānamāna yaḥ mayā vādena vādam samāraddhaḥ na saṅkampeyya na  sampakampeyya na sampavedheyya yassa na kacchehi sedāḥ mucceyyu
translated: whose discussion would not collapse and fall to pieces if he were to engage me in discussion.

original: Thūṇaṁ cepāhaṁ acetanaṁ vādena vādaṁ samārabheyyaṁ, sāpi mayā vādena vādaṁ samāraddhā saṅkampeyya sampakampeyya sampavedheyya.
analyzed: thūṇam ca ipa aham acetanam vādena vādam samārabheyya sā api mayā vādena vādam samāraddhā saṅkampeyya sampakampeyya sampavedheyya
translated: If I were to engage a post or a stump or a wall or an empty seat in discussion, it would collapse and fall to pieces.

original: Ko pana vādo manussabhūtassā”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ pana vādaḥ manussa bhūtassa ati
translated: How much more, then, a human being?”

original: Atha kho āyasmā assaji pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho āyasmai assaji pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya vesālim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, when it was morning, Ven. Assaji adjusted his under robe and–carrying his bowl & robes–went into Vesālī for alms.

original: Addasā kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto vesāliyaṁ jaṅghāvihāraṁ anucaṅkamamāno anuvicaramāno āyasmantaṁ assajiṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.🔽Disvāna yenāyasmā assaji tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā assajinā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: addasā kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ vesāliyam jaṅghāvihāram anucaṅkamamānaḥ anuvicaramānaḥ āyasmantam assajim dūratas vā āgacchanta  disvāna yena āyasmai assaji tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā assajinā saddhim sammodi
translated: Saccaka the son of Nigaṇṭha, while wandering & walking about Vesālī for exercise, saw Ven. Assaji coming in the distance.🔽On seeing him, he went to him and, on arrival, exchanged courteous greetings with him.

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto āyasmantaṁ assajiṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam aṭṭhāsi ekamantam ṭhitaḥ kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ āyasmantam assajim etat avoca
translated: After an exchange of friendly greetings & courtesies, he stood to one side. As he was standing there, he said to Ven. Assaji, “How is it, my friend: Is the contemplative Gotama well & steadied? Is he more comfortable? “🔽“Friend, the Blessed One is well & steadied. He’s more comfortable. “

original: “kathaṁ pana, bho assaji, samaṇo gotamo sāvake vineti, kathaṁbhāgā ca pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattatī”ti?
analyzed: katham pana bho assaji samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ sāvake vineti kathabhāgā ca pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati iti
translated: “But, my friend, how does the contemplative Gotama train the disciples in what he teaches, and how does the Dhamma’s practice that the contemplative Gotama teaches lead to the disciples’ unabiding? “

original: “Evaṁ kho, aggivessana, bhagavā sāvake vineti, evaṁbhāgā ca pana bhagavato sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati:
analyzed: evam kho aggivessana bhagavā sāvake vineti evabhāgā ca pana bhagavataḥ sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati
translated: “Friend, the Blessed One teaches the disciples in this way: ‘Abandon evil. Practice what is skillful.’ This is how the Blessed One teaches the disciples in what he teaches. And this is how the Dhamma’s practice that the Blessed One teaches leads to the disciples’ unabiding:

original: ‘rūpaṁ, bhikkhave, aniccaṁ, vedanā aniccā, saññā aniccā, saṅkhārā aniccā, viññāṇaṁ aniccaṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave anicca vedanā aniccā saññā aniccā saṅkhārāḥ aniccā viññāṇam anicca
translated: ‘Form, monks, is impermanent, feeling is impermanent, perception is impermanent, volitions are impermanent, consciousness is impermanent.

original: Rūpaṁ, bhikkhave, anattā, vedanā anattā, saññā anattā, saṅkhārā anattā, viññāṇaṁ anattā.
analyzed: bhikkhave anattā vedanā anattā saññā anattā saṅkhārāḥ anattā viññāṇam anattā
translated: Form is not self, feeling is not self, perception is not self, volitions are not self, consciousness is not self.

original: Sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā, sabbe dhammā anattā’ti.
analyzed: sabbe saṅkhārāḥ aniccā sabbe dhammāḥ anattā ti
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent, all conditioned things are suffering, all dhammas are not self.’

original: Evaṁ kho, aggivessana, bhagavā sāvake vineti, evaṁbhāgā ca pana bhagavato sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattatī”ti.
analyzed: evam kho aggivessana bhagavā sāvake vinā iti evabhāgā ca pana bhagavataḥ sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati iti
translated: This is how the Blessed One instructs the disciples, and this is the kind of instruction to the disciples that is frequently repeated.”

original: “Dussutaṁ vata, bho assaji, assumha ye mayaṁ evaṁvādiṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ assumha.
analyzed: dussutam vata bho assaji assumha ye mayam eva vādim samaṇam gotamam assumha
translated: “What a misfortune for us, Assaji, that we have heard such a doctrine from the recluse Gotama!

original: Appeva nāma mayaṁ kadāci karahaci tena bhotā gotamena saddhiṁ samāgaccheyyāma, appeva nāma siyā kocideva kathāsallāpo, appeva nāma tasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā viveceyyāmā”ti.
analyzed: appā iva nāma mayam kadāci karahaci tena bhotā gotamena saddhim samāgaccheyyāma appā iva nāma siyā kocid eva kathā sallāpaḥ appā iva nāma tasmā pāpakāḥ diṭṭhi gatāḥ viveceyyāma ati
translated: Perhaps we might have met the recluse Gotama on terms of mutual agreement, perhaps we might have had some conversation with him, perhaps he might have turned away from that evil view.

original: Tena kho pana samayena pañcamattāni licchavisatāni santhāgāre sannipatitāni honti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena pañca mattāni licchavi satāni santhāgāre sannipatitāni honti kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: Now at that time about five hundred Licchavis had assembled in the public hall for some business or other.

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yena te licchavī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te licchavī etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ yena te licchavī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te licchavī etat avoca
translated: Then Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha went to those Licchavis and said to them:

original: “abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī, abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī, ajja me samaṇena gotamena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo bhavissati.
analyzed: abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī ajja me samaṇena gotamena saddhim kathā sallāpaḥ bhavissati
translated: “Come out, gentlemen, Licchavis, come out, gentlemen, Licchavis, today there will be a discussion between me and the recluse Gotama.

original: Sace me samaṇo gotamo tathā patiṭṭhissati yathā ca me ñātaññatarena sāvakena assajinā🔽nāma bhikkhunā patiṭṭhitaṁ, seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso dīghalomikaṁ eḷakaṁ lomesu
analyzed: sace me samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ tathā patiṭṭhissati yathā ca me ñātaññatarena sāvakena assajinā  nāma bhikkhunā patiṭṭhita seyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ dīghalomikam eḷakam lomesu
translated: If the recluse Gotama will stand by what he said to my pupil, the recluse Assaji,

original: gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya;
analyzed: gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya
translated: just as a strong man might seize a long-haired ram by the hair and drag him to and drag him fro and drag him about,

original: evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.
analyzed: evam eva aham samaṇam gotamam vādena vādam ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi
translated: even so will I drag the recluse Gotama to and drag him fro and drag him about with the discussion.🔽Just as a strong butcher or his apprentice might pin a large pig to the ground with his left foot

original: Seyyathāpi nāma balavā soṇḍikākammakāro mahantaṁ soṇḍikākiḷañjaṁ gambhīre udakarahade pakkhipitvā kaṇṇe gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma balavā soṇḍikā kammakāraḥ mahantam soṇḍikā kiḷañjam gambhīre udaka rahade pakkhipitvā kaṇṇe gahetvā ākaḍḍheyya parikaḍḍheyya samparikaḍḍheyya
translated: and, taking a sharp knife with his right hand, would cut up the belly and cut the entrails loose and drag them to and drag them fro and drag them about,

original: evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi.
analyzed: evam eva aham samaṇam gotamam vādena vādam ākaḍḍhissāmi parikaḍḍhissāmi samparikaḍḍhissāmi
translated: I will drag the ascetic Gotama along with the discussion, I will pull him along with the discussion, I will haul him along with the discussion.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma balavā soṇḍikādhutto vālaṁ kaṇṇe gahetvā odhuneyya niddhuneyya nipphoṭeyya;
analyzed: sa iyyathā api nāma balavā soṇḍikā dhuttaḥ vālam kaṇṇe gahetvā odhuneyya niddhuneyya nipphoṭeyya
translated: Just as a strong man might drag a weaker man along with the discussion, pull him along with the discussion, haul him along with the discussion;

original: evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ odhunissāmi niddhunissāmi nipphoṭessāmi.
analyzed: evam eva aham samaṇam gotamam vādena vādam odhunissāmi niddhunissāmi nipphoṭessāmi
translated: in the same way, I will drag the ascetic Gotama along with the discussion, pull him along with the discussion, haul him along with the discussion.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma kuñjaro saṭṭhihāyano gambhīraṁ pokkharaṇiṁ ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikaṁ nāma kīḷitajātaṁ kīḷati;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma kuñjaraḥ saṭṭhihāyanaḥ gambhīram pokkharaṇim ogāhetvā sāṇadhovikam nāma kīḷita jātam kīḷati
translated: Just as a sixty-year-old elephant might enter a deep lake and play the game called ‘washing the ears’;

original: evamevāhaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ sāṇadhovikaṁ maññe kīḷitajātaṁ kīḷissāmi.
analyzed: evam eva aham samaṇam gotamam sāṇadhovikam maññe kīḷita jātam kīḷissāmi
translated: in the same way, I will play the game called ‘washing the ears’ with the ascetic Gotama.

original: Abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī, abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī, ajja me samaṇena gotamena saddhiṁ kathāsallāpo bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī abhikkamantu bhonto licchavī ajja me samaṇena gotamena saddhim kathā sallāpaḥ bhavissati iti
translated: Go forth, Licchavīs, go forth, Licchavīs, today there will be a discussion between me and the ascetic Gotama.”

original: Tatrekacce licchavī evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: tatra ekacce licchavī
translated: Therein, some Licchavīs said this:

original: “kiṁ samaṇo gotamo saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa vādaṁ āropessati, atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto samaṇassa gotamassa vādaṁ āropessatī”ti?
analyzed: kim samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ saccakassa nigaṇṭha puttassa vādam āropessati atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha putto samaṇassa gotamassa vādam āropessati iti
translated: “Will the ascetic Gotama refute Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha? Or will Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha refute the ascetic Gotama?”

original: Ekacce licchavī evamāhaṁsu:
analyzed: ekacce licchavī evam āhasu
translated: Some of the Licchavīs said:

original: “kiṁ so bhavamāno saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yo bhagavato vādaṁ āropessati, atha kho bhagavā saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa vādaṁ āropessatī”ti?
analyzed: kim saḥ bhavamānaḥ saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha putto yaḥ bhagavataḥ vādam āropessati atha kho bhagavā saccakassa nigaṇṭha puttassa vādam āropessati iti
translated: “How could the venerable Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha refute the Fortunate One? The Fortunate One would refute Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha.”

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto pañcamattehi licchavisatehi parivuto yena mahāvanaṁ kūṭāgārasālā tenupasaṅkami.
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha putto pañca mattehi licchavi satehi parivutaḥ yena mahā vanam kūṭāgāra sālā tena upasaṅkami
translated: Then Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha, surrounded by about five hundred Licchavīs, approached the Gabled Hall in the Great Forest.

original: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū abbhokāse caṅkamanti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena sambahulāḥ bhikkhū abbhokāse caṅkamanti
translated: At that time many monks were walking up and down in the open air.

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto yena te bhikkhū tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ yena te bhikkhū tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā te bhikkhū etat avoca
translated: Then Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha approached those monks and said this to them:

original: “kahaṁ nu kho, bho, etarahi so bhavaṁ gotamo viharati?
analyzed: kaham nu khalu bho etarahi saḥ bhavam gotamaḥ viharati
translated: “Where is the reverend Gotama at present?

original: Dassanakāmā hi mayaṁ taṁ bhavantaṁ gotaman”ti.
analyzed: dassana kāmāḥ hi mayam tam bhavantam gotamanti
translated: We wish to see the reverend Gotama.”

original: “Esa, aggivessana, bhagavā mahāvanaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisinno”ti.
analyzed: esa aggivessana bhagavā mahā vanam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmin rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisinnaḥ ti
translated: “He has gone into the Great Wood and is sitting at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.”

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto mahatiyā licchaviparisāya saddhiṁ mahāvanaṁ ajjhogāhetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ mahatiyā licchavi parisāya saddhim mahā vanam ajjhogāhetvā yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhim sammodi
translated: Then Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha went into the Great Wood with a large group of Licchavis and approached the Lord; having approached, he exchanged greetings with the Lord;

original: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.🔽Tepi kho licchavī appekacce bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce🔽bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ🔽nisīdiṁsu. Appekacce yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce
analyzed: sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamantam nisīdi  te api kho licchavī appa ekacce bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appa ekacce  bhagavatā saddhim sammodisu sammodanīyam katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā ekamanta  nisīdisu appa ekacce yena bhagavā tena añjalim paṇāmetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appa ekacce
translated: having exchanged agreeable and courteous greetings, he sat down to one side.🔽And some of the Licchavis having greeted the Lord sat down to one side,

original: bhagavato santike nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu, appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: bhagavatoḥ santike nāma gottam sāvetvā ekamantam nisīdisu appekacce tuṇhībhūtāḥ ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: some exchanged greetings with the Lord and after this courteous talk sat down to one side, some extended their hands in reverential salutation towards the Lord and sat down to one side, some pronounced their name and family to the Lord and sat down to one side, some kept silent and sat down to one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: and said to the Lord:

original: “puccheyyāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ kiñcideva desaṁ, sace me bhavaṁ gotamo okāsaṁ karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāyā”ti.
analyzed: puccheyya aham bhavantam gotamam kiñcid eva sace me bhavam gotamaḥ okāsam karoti pañhassa veyyākaraṇāya ati
translated: “I would like to ask the Lord Gotama about a certain matter, if he would give me the opportunity to put a question.”

original: “Puccha, aggivessana, yadākaṅkhasī”ti.
analyzed: puccha aggivessana yat ākaṅkhasi iti
translated: “Ask, Aggivessana, whatever you want.”

original: “Kathaṁ pana bhavaṁ gotamo sāvake vineti, kathaṁbhāgā ca pana bhoto gotamassa sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattatī”ti?
analyzed: katham pana bhavam gotamaḥ sāvake vineti kathabhāgā ca pana bhoto gotamassa sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati iti
translated: “But how, Master Gotama, does Master Gotama instruct his disciples, and how does he admonish them when he admonishes them?”

original: “Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, sāvake vinemi, evaṁbhāgā ca pana me sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati:
analyzed: evam kho aha aggivessana sāvake vinemi evabhāgā ca pana me sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati
translated: “I instruct my disciples thus, Aggivessana, and I admonish them thus when I admonish them:

original: ‘rūpaṁ, bhikkhave, aniccaṁ, vedanā aniccā, saññā aniccā, saṅkhārā aniccā, viññāṇaṁ aniccaṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave anicca vedanā aniccā saññā aniccā saṅkhārāḥ aniccā viññāṇam anicca
translated: ‘Form, bhikkhus, is impermanent, feeling is impermanent, perception is impermanent, volitional formations are impermanent, consciousness is impermanent.

original: Rūpaṁ, bhikkhave, anattā, vedanā anattā, saññā anattā, saṅkhārā anattā, viññāṇaṁ anattā.
analyzed: bhikkhave anattā vedanā anattā saññā anattā saṅkhārāḥ anattā viññāṇam anattā
translated: Form is non-self, bhikkhus, feeling is non-self, perception is non-self, volitional formations are non-self, consciousness is non-self.

original: Sabbe saṅkhārā aniccā, sabbe dhammā anattā’ti.
analyzed: sabbe saṅkhārāḥ aniccā sabbe dhammāḥ anattā ti
translated: All formations are impermanent, all things are non-self.’

original: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, aggivessana, sāvake vinemi, evaṁbhāgā ca pana me sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattatī”ti.
analyzed: evam kho aha aggivessana sāvake vinemi evabhāgā ca pana me sāvakesu anusāsanī bahulā pavattati iti

analyzed: yā kāci saññā pe
translated: Any kind of perception …

original: ye keci saṅkhārā …pe…🔽yaṁ kiñci viññāṇaṁ atītānāgatapaccuppannaṁ ajjhattaṁ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṁ vā sukhumaṁ🔽vā hīnaṁ vā paṇītaṁ vā yaṁ dūre santike vā sabbaṁ viññāṇaṁ ‘netaṁ mama, nesohamasmi,
analyzed: ye keci saṅkhārāḥ  yam kiñci viññāṇam atīta anāgata paccuppannam ajjhattam vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikam vā  vā hīnam vā paṇītam vā yam dūre santike vā sabbam viññāṇam na itam mama na isī ham asmi
translated: Any kind of volitional formations …🔽Any kind of consciousness, whether past, future, or present, internal or external, gross or fine, inferior or excellent, whether far or near, seeing all consciousness as it really is with correct wisdom thus:

original: na meso attā’ti evametaṁ yathābhūtaṁ sammappaññāya disvā anupādā vimutto hoti.
analyzed: na mā isaḥ attā ati evam etam yathābhūtam sammappaññāya disvā anupādā vimuttaḥ hoti
translated: ‘This is not mine, this I am not, this is not my self,’ he is liberated by nonclinging.

original: Ettāvatā kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu arahaṁ hoti khīṇāsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohitabhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṁyojano sammadaññāvimutto.
analyzed: ettāvatā kho aggivessana bhikkhu araham hoti khīṇa āsavaḥ vusitavā kata karaṇīyaḥ ohita bhāraḥ an uppatta sadattho parikkhīṇa bhava sayojanaḥ sammad aññā vimutto
translated: To this extent, Aggivessana, a bhikkhu is accomplished in discernment, that is, in the discernment of the way things are in the sense of their impermanence, suffering, and non-self.

original: Evaṁ vimuttacitto kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu tīhi anuttariyehi samannāgato hoti—
analyzed: evam vimutta cittaḥ kho aggivessana bhikkhu tīhi anuttariyehi samannāgataḥ hoti
translated: A monk whose mind is freed like this possesses three things that are unsurpassed:

original: dassanānuttariyena, paṭipadānuttariyena, vimuttānuttariyena.
analyzed: dassana anuttariyena paṭipadā anuttariyena vimutta anuttariyena
translated: unsurpassed vision, unsurpassed practice, and unsurpassed freedom.

original: Evaṁ vimuttacitto kho, aggivessana, bhikkhu tathāgataññeva sakkaroti garuṁ karoti māneti pūjeti—
analyzed: evam vimutta cittaḥ kho aggivessana bhikkhu tathāgatañca eva sakkaroti garum karoti māneti pūjeti
translated: A monk whose mind is freed like this honors, respects, reveres, and venerates the Buddha alone.

original: buddho so bhagavā bodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, danto so bhagavā damathāya dhammaṁ deseti,
analyzed: buddhaḥ saḥ bhagavā bodhāya dhammam deseti dantaḥ saḥ bhagavā damathāya dhammam deseti
translated: The Buddha is enlightened and teaches the Dhamma for the sake of enlightenment. He is tamed and teaches the Dhamma for the sake of taming.

original: santo so bhagavā samathāya dhammaṁ deseti, tiṇṇo so bhagavā taraṇāya dhammaṁ deseti,
analyzed: santaḥ saḥ bhagavā samathāya dhammam deseti tiṇṇaḥ saḥ bhagavā taraṇāya dhammam deseti
translated: He is at peace and teaches the Dhamma for the sake of peace. He has crossed over and teaches the Dhamma for the sake of crossing over.

original: parinibbuto so bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammaṁ desetī”ti.
analyzed: parinibbutaḥ saḥ bhagavā parinibbānāya dhammam deseti iti
translated: He is totally unbound and teaches the Dhamma for the sake of total unbinding.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, Saccaka said to the Buddha,

original: “mayameva, bho gotama, dhaṁsī, mayaṁ pagabbā, ye mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ āsādetabbaṁ amaññimha.
analyzed: mayam eva bho gotama dhasī mayam pagabbāḥ ye mayam bhavantam gotamam vādena vādam āsādetabbam amaññimha
translated: “We’re lost, Master Gotama, we’re confused, in that we thought we could challenge Master Gotama to debate.

original: Siyā hi, bho gotama, hatthiṁ pabhinnaṁ āsajja purisassa sotthibhāvo, na tveva bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ āsajja siyā purisassa sotthibhāvo.🔽Siyā hi, bho gotama, pajjalitaṁ aggikkhandhaṁ āsajja purisassa sotthibhāvo, na tveva bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ āsajja siyā purisassa sotthibhāvo.
analyzed: siyā hi bho gotama hatthim pabhinnam āsajja purisassa sotthi bhāvaḥ na tu eva bhavantam gotamam āsajja siyā purisassa sotthi bhāvaḥ  siyā hi bho gotama pajjalitam aggi kkhandham āsajja purisassa sotthi bhāvaḥ na tu eva bhavantam gotamam āsajja siyā purisassa sotthi bhāvaḥ
translated: For it might be that a man would recover from being struck by an elephant, but not from striking the Blessed One.🔽For it might be that a man would recover from being struck by a blazing grass torch, but not from striking the Blessed One.

original: Siyā hi, bho gotama, āsīvisaṁ ghoravisaṁ āsajja purisassa sotthibhāvo, na tveva bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ āsajja siyā purisassa sotthibhāvo.
analyzed: siyā hi bho gotama āsīvisam ghora visam āsajja purisassa sotthi bhāvaḥ na tu eva bhavantam gotamam āsajja siyā purisassa sotthi bhāvaḥ
translated: For it might be that a man would recover from being struck by a poisonous snake, but not from striking the Blessed One.

original: Mayameva, bho gotama, dhaṁsī, mayaṁ pagabbā, ye mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ vādena vādaṁ āsādetabbaṁ amaññimha.
analyzed: mayam eva bho gotama dhasī mayam pagabbāḥ ye mayam bhavantam gotamam vādena vādam āsādetabbam amaññimha
translated: We are the ones who are foolish, confused, and unskillful, in that we thought to dispute the dispute with Master Gotama.

original: Adhivāsetu me bhavaṁ gotamo svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
analyzed: adhivāsetu me bhavam gotamaḥ svātanāya bhattam saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena ati
translated: May Master Gotama acquiesce to my meal tomorrow, together with the Saṅgha of monks.”

original: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
analyzed: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One acquiesced by remaining silent.

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā te licchavī āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavataḥ adhivāsanam viditvā te licchavī āmantesi
translated: Then Saccaka the son of Nigaṇṭha, having understood that the Blessed One had acquiesced, addressed the Licchavīs,🔽saying:

original: “suṇantu me bhonto licchavī, samaṇo me gotamo nimantito svātanāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: suṇantu me bhontaḥ licchavī samaṇaḥ me gotamaḥ nimantitaḥ svātanāya saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: “Please listen to me, Licchavis! I have invited the ascetic Gotama and his Sangha of monks for tomorrow’s meal.

original: Tena me abhihareyyātha yamassa patirūpaṁ maññeyyāthā”ti.
analyzed: tena me abhihareyyātha yamassa pati rūpam maññeyyātha ati
translated: Please give me what’s appropriate.”

original: Atha kho te licchavī tassā rattiyā accayena saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa pañcamattāni thālipākasatāni bhattābhihāraṁ abhihariṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho te licchavī tassāḥ rattiyāḥ accayena saccakassa nigaṇṭha puttassa pañca mattāni thālipāka satāni bhatta abhihāram abhiharisu
translated: The next morning Saccaka had five hundred copper pots of food brought to the Nigaṇṭha’s monastery.

original: Atha kho nigaṇṭhaputto sake ārāme paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:🔽“kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
analyzed: atha kho nigaṇṭha putto sake ārāme paṇītam khādanīyam bhojanīyam paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavataḥ kālam ārocāpesi  kālaḥ bho gotama niṭṭhitam bhattanti
translated: He then had the Buddha informed that the meal was ready.

original: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena saccakassa nigaṇṭhaputtassa ārāmo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya yena saccakassa nigaṇṭha puttassa ārāmaḥ tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi saddhim bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The Buddha robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Saccaka’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat together with the Sangha of monks.

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ buddha ppamukham bhikkhu saṅgham paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi
translated: Then Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha, with his own hands, served and satisfied the Community of monks with the Buddha at its head with exquisite staple and non-staple food.

original: Atha kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavantam bhuttāvim onīta patta pāṇim aññataram nīcam āsanam gahetvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: Then when the Fortunate One had eaten and had washed his hand and bowl, he sat down on one side.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho saccako nigaṇṭhaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho saccakaḥ nigaṇṭha puttaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: While sitting on one side Saccaka the son of Nigan.tha said this to the Fortunate One:

original: “yamidaṁ, bho gotama, dāne puññañca puññamahī ca taṁ dāyakānaṁ sukhāya hotū”ti.
analyzed: yam idam bho gotama dāne puññam ca puñña mahī ca tam dāyakānam sukhāya hotu uti
translated: “What is given to those worthy of offerings, Master Gotama, and what is given to those who are not worthy of offerings, may both of these be for the happiness of the giver.”

original: “Yaṁ kho, aggivessana, tādisaṁ dakkhiṇeyyaṁ āgamma avītarāgaṁ avītadosaṁ avītamohaṁ, taṁ dāyakānaṁ bhavissati.
analyzed: yam kho aggivessana tādisam dakkhiṇeyyam āgamma a vīta rāgam a vīta dosam a vīta moha tam dāyakānam bhavissati
translated: “Aggivessana, what is given to those worthy of offerings, and what is given to those who are not worthy of offerings, will be for the happiness of the giver.

original: Yaṁ kho, aggivessana, mādisaṁ dakkhiṇeyyaṁ āgamma vītarāgaṁ vītadosaṁ vītamohaṁ, taṁ tuyhaṁ bhavissatī”ti.
analyzed: yam kho aggivessana mādisam dakkhiṇeyyam āgamma vīta rāgam vīta dosam vīta moha tam tuyham bhavissati iti
translated: But what is given to those worthy of offerings, and what is given to those who are not worthy of offerings, will be for the happiness of the giver.”

original: Cūḷasaccakasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: cūḷasaccaka suttam niṭṭhitam pañcama
translated: The Short Discourse with Saccaka is finished.
